fields.name: availableShippingRates
fields.description:
The available shipping rates for this Checkout.
Should only be used when checkout `requiresShipping` is `true` and
the shipping address is valid.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the checkout was completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the checkout was created.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The currency code for the Checkout.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of extra information that is added to the checkout.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer associated with the checkout.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email attached to this checkout.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: A list of line item objects, each one containing information about an item in the checkout.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The resulting order from a paid checkout.

fields.name: orderStatusUrl
fields.description: The Order Status Page for this Checkout, null when checkout is not completed.

fields.name: paymentDue
fields.description: The amount left to be paid. This is equal to the cost of the line items, taxes and shipping minus discounts and gift cards.

fields.name: ready
fields.description: Whether or not the Checkout is ready and can be completed. Checkouts may have asynchronous operations that can take time to finish. If you want to complete a checkout or ensure all the fields are populated and up to date, polling is required until the value is true.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: States whether or not the fulfillment requires shipping.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: The shipping address to where the line items will be shipped.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: Once a shipping rate is selected by the customer it is transitioned to a `shipping_line` object.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Price of the checkout before shipping, taxes, and discounts.

fields.name: taxExempt
fields.description: Specifies if the Checkout is tax exempt.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Specifies if taxes are included in the line item and shipping line prices.

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the checkout, taxes and discounts included.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the line items and shipping lines in the checkout.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the checkout was last updated.

fields.name: webUrl
fields.description: The url pointing to the checkout accessible from the web.

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Indicates if there are more pages to fetch.

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Indicates if there are any pages prior to the current page.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: ProductVariant
types.description: A product variant represents a different version of a product, such as differing sizes or differing colors.

fields.name: available
fields.description: Indicates if the product variant is in stock.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the product variant.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: crop
args.description: If specified, crop the image keeping the specified region

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3

fields.name: price
fields.description: The product variant’s price.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product object that the product variant belongs to.

fields.name: selectedOptions
fields.description: List of product options applied to the variant.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The product variant’s title.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight of the product variant in the unit system specified with `weight_unit`.

fields.name: weightUnit
fields.description: Unit of measurement for weight.

types.name: Float
types.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: WeightUnit
types.description: Units of measurements for weight.

types.name: Money
types.description: A monetary value string.

types.name: Image
types.description: Represents an image resource.

fields.name: altText
fields.description: A word or phrase to share the nature or contents of an image.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the image.

fields.name: src
fields.description: The location of the image as a URL.

types.name: URL
types.description: An RFC 3986 and RFC 3987 compliant URI string.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: CropRegion
types.description: The part of the image that should remain after cropping.

enumValues.name: CENTER
enumValues.description: Keep the center of the image

enumValues.name: TOP
enumValues.description: Keep the top of the image

enumValues.name: BOTTOM
enumValues.description: Keep the bottom of the image

enumValues.name: LEFT
enumValues.description: Keep the left of the image

enumValues.name: RIGHT
enumValues.description: Keep the right of the image

types.name: SelectedOption
types.description:
Custom properties that a shop owner can use to define product variants.
Multiple options can exist. Options are represented as: option1, option2, option3, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The product option’s name.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The product option’s value.

types.name: Product
types.description:
A product represents an individual item for sale in a Shopify store. Products are often physical, but they don't have to be. 
For example, a digital download (such as a movie, music or ebook file) also qualifies as a product, as do services (such as equipment rental, work for hire, customization of another product or an extended warranty).

fields.name: collections
fields.description: List of collections a product belongs to.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the product was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Stripped description of the product, single line with HTML tags removed.

args.name: truncateAt
args.description: Truncates string after the given length.

fields.name: descriptionHtml
fields.description: The description of the product, complete with HTML formatting.

fields.name: descriptionPlainSummary
fields.description:
Stripped description of the product, single line with HTML tags removed.
Truncated to 60 characters.

fields.name: handle
fields.description:
A human-friendly unique string for the Product automatically generated from its title.
They are used by the Liquid templating language to refer to objects.

fields.name: images
fields.description: List of images associated with the product.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: crop
args.description: If specified, crop the image keeping the specified region

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3

fields.name: options
fields.description: Lst of custom product options (maximum of 3 per product).

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size

fields.name: productType
fields.description: A categorization that a product can be tagged with, commonly used for filtering and searching.

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the product was published to the Online Store channel.
A value of `null` indicates that the product is not published to Online Store.

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
A categorization that a product can be tagged with, commonly used for filtering and searching.
Each comma-separated tag has a character limit of 255.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The product’s title.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the product was last modified.

fields.name: variants
fields.description: List of the product’s variants.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: The product’s vendor name.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: Collection
types.description: A collection represents a grouping of products that a shop owner can create to organize them or make their shops easier to browse.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Stripped description of the collection, single line with HTML tags removed.

args.name: truncateAt
args.description: Truncates string after the given length.

fields.name: descriptionHtml
fields.description: The description of the collection, complete with HTML formatting.

fields.name: descriptionPlainSummary
fields.description:
Stripped description of the collection, single line with HTML tags removed.
Truncated to 60 characters.

fields.name: handle
fields.description:
A human-friendly unique string for the collection automatically generated from its title.
Limit of 255 characters.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the collection.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048

args.name: crop
args.description: If specified, crop the image keeping the specified region

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3

fields.name: products
fields.description: List of products in the collection.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The collection’s name. Limit of 255 characters.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the collection was last modified.

types.name: HTML
types.description: A string containing HTML code.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date string.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID to support global identification.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: ProductOption
types.description:
Custom product property names like "Size", "Color", and "Material".
Products are based on permutations of these options.
A product may have a maximum of 3 options.
255 characters limit each.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The product option’s name.

fields.name: values
fields.description: The corresponding value to the product option name.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: Attribute
types.description: Represents a generic custom attribute.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key or name of the attribute.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the attribute.

fields.name: ready
fields.description:
Whether or not the shipping rates are ready.
The `shippingRates` field is `null` when this value is `false`.
This field should be polled until its value becomes `true`.

fields.name: shippingRates
fields.description: The fetched shipping rates. `null` until the `ready` field is `true`.

types.name: Customer
types.description: A customer represents a customer account with the shop. Customer accounts store contact information for the customer, saving logged-in customers the trouble of having to provide it at every checkout.

fields.name: acceptsMarketing
fields.description: Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing material via email.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: A list of addresses for the customer.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer was created.

fields.name: defaultAddress
fields.description: The customer’s default address.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The customer’s name, email or phone number.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer’s email address.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The customer’s first name.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The customer’s last name.

fields.name: orders
fields.description: The orders associated with the customer.

args.name: query
args.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `status`
 - `financial_status`
 - `fulfillment_status`
 - `source_name`
 - `chargeback_status`
 - `risk_level`
 - `customer_id`
 - `email`
 - `credit_card_last4`
 - `processed_at`
 - `checkout_token`
 - `cart_token`
 - `location_id`
 - `channel_id`
 - `discount_code`
 - `tag`
 - `since_id`
 - `updated_at`
 - `created_at`

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The customer’s phone number.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer information was updated.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: Order
types.description: An order is a customer’s completed request to purchase one or more products from a shop. An order is created when a customer completes the checkout process, during which time they provides an email address, billing address and payment information.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
The reason why the order was cancelled.
If the order was not cancelled, this value is `null`.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was cancelled.
If the order was not cancelled, this value is `null.`

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The code of the currency used for the payment.

fields.name: customerUrl
fields.description: The order’s URL for a customer.

fields.name: displayFinancialStatus
fields.description: Displays financial status of order payment processing.

fields.name: displayFulfillmentStatus
fields.description: Displays fulfillment status of the order.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: List of the order’s line items.

fields.name: orderNumber
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order for use by shop owner and customer.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was imported.
This value can be set to dates in the past when importing from other systems.
If no value is provided, it will be auto-generated based on current date and time.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: The address to where the order will be shipped.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes.

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes and discounts included (must be positive).

fields.name: totalRefunded
fields.description: The total amount that has been refunded.

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: The total cost of shipping.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The total cost of taxes.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the order was last modified.

types.name: CurrencyCode
types.description: Currency codes

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: OrderLineItem
types.description: Represents a single line in an order. There is one line item for each distinct product variant.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of custom attributes associated to the line item.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of products variants associated to the line item.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the product combined with title of the variant.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The product variant object associated to the line item.

types.name: OrderSortKeys
types.description: The set of valid sort keys for the orders query.

fields.name: amountUsed
fields.description: The amount that was used taken from the Gift Card by applying it.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The amount left on the Gift Card.

fields.name: lastCharacters
fields.description: The last characters of the Gift Card code

types.name: QueryRoot
types.description: The schema’s entry-point for queries. This acts as the public, top-level API from which all queries must start.

args.name: customerAccessToken
args.description: The customer access token

types.name: Shop
types.description: Shop represents a collection of the general settings and information about the shop.

fields.name: collections
fields.description: List of the shop’ collections.

args.name: query
args.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `title`
 - `collection_type`
 - `updated_at`
 - `published_status`

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The three-letter code for the currency that the shop accepts.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the shop.

fields.name: moneyFormat
fields.description: A string representing the way currency is formatted when the currency isn’t specified.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The shop’s name.

fields.name: primaryDomain
fields.description: The shop’s primary domain.

fields.name: privacyPolicy
fields.description: The shop’s privacy policy.

fields.name: products
fields.description: List of the shop’ products.

args.name: query
args.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `title`
 - `product_type`
 - `vendor`
 - `gift_card`
 - `sku`
 - `barcode`
 - `inventory_total`
 - `created_at`
 - `updated_at`
 - `published_status`
 - `tag`

fields.name: refundPolicy
fields.description: The shop’s refund policy.

fields.name: termsOfService
fields.description: The shop’s terms of service.

types.name: Domain
types.description: Represents a web address.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The host name of the domain (eg: `example.com`).

fields.name: sslEnabled
fields.description: Whether SSL is enabled or not.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the domain (eg: `https://example.com`).

types.name: ShopPolicy
types.description: Policy that a merchant has configured for their store, such as their refund or privacy policy.

fields.name: body
fields.description: Policy text, maximum size of 64kb.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Policy’s title.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Public URL to the policy.

types.name: CollectionSortKeys
types.description: The set of valid sort keys for the collections query.

types.name: ProductSortKeys
types.description: The set of valid sort keys for the products query.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The schema’s entry-point for mutations. This acts as the public, top-level API from which all mutation queries must start.

args.description: The code of the gift card to apply on the checkout.

args.name: checkoutId
args.description: The ID of the checkout.

fields.name: customerAccessTokenCreate
fields.description:
Creates a customer access token.
The customer access token is required to modify the customer object in any way.

args.description: The access token used to identify the customer.

types.name: UserError

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: CheckoutAttributesUpdateInput
types.description: Specifies the fields required to update a checkout's attributes.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the checkout.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: A list of extra information that is added to the checkout.

inputFields.name: allowPartialAddresses
inputFields.description:
Allows setting partial addresses on a Checkout, skipping the full validation of attributes.
The required attributes are city, province, and country.
Full validation of the addresses is still done at complete time.

fields.name: checkout
fields.description: The updated checkout object.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

fields.name: maskedNumber
fields.description: Masked credit card number with only the last 4 digits displayed

types.name: CreditCardPaymentInput
types.description:
Specifies the fields required to complete a checkout with
a Shopify vaulted credit card payment.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of the payment.

inputFields.name: idempotencyKey
inputFields.description: A unique client generated key used to avoid duplicate charges. When a duplicate payment is found, the original is returned instead of creating a new one.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The billing address for the payment.

inputFields.name: vaultId
inputFields.description: The ID returned by Shopify's Card Vault.

inputFields.name: test
inputFields.description: Executes the payment in test mode if possible. Defaults to `false`.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

types.name: TokenizedPaymentInput
types.description:
Specifies the fields required to complete a checkout with
a tokenized payment.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of the payment.

inputFields.name: idempotencyKey
inputFields.description: A unique client generated key used to avoid duplicate charges. When a duplicate payment is found, the original is returned instead of creating a new one.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The billing address for the payment.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of payment token.

inputFields.name: paymentData
inputFields.description: A simple string or JSON containing the required payment data for the tokenized payment.

inputFields.name: test
inputFields.description: Executes the payment in test mode if possible. Defaults to `false`.

inputFields.name: identifier
inputFields.description: Public Hash Key used for AndroidPay payments only.

fields.name: checkout
fields.description: The new checkout object.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

inputFields.description: The email with which the customer wants to checkout.

inputFields.name: lineItems

inputFields.name: shippingAddress
inputFields.description: The shipping address to where the line items will be shipped.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the checkout.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: A list of extra information that is added to the checkout.

inputFields.name: allowPartialAddresses
inputFields.description:
Allows setting partial addresses on a Checkout, skipping the full validation of attributes.
The required attributes are city, province, and country.
Full validation of addresses is still done at complete time.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
